hints.content:
Numbers are equivalent when they represent the same place on the number line.

Let's compare each point to $\blueD{\dfrac24}$ and find the equivalent fraction.

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle shows one whole divided into four equal parts. Each part is labeled one-fourth. Two parts are shaded. The rectangle on the bottom shows one whole divided into three equal parts. Each part is labeled one-third. Two parts are shaded. A number line below the rectangles shows tick marks above the number line from zero-fourths to four-fourths and below the number line from zero-thirds to three-thirds. A blue point appears at the tick mark two-fourths. A pink point appears at the tick mark two-thirds. The blue point is to the left of the pink point. !

Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle shows one whole divided into four equal parts. Each part is labeled one-fourth. Two parts are shaded. The rectangle on the bottom shows one whole divided into six equal parts. Each part is labeled one-sixth. Two parts are shaded. A number line below the rectangles shows tick marks above the number line from zero-fourths to four-fourths and below the number line from zero-sixths to six-sixths. A blue point appears at the tick mark two-fourths. A green point appears at the tick mark two-sixths. The blue point is to the right of the green point. !

Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle shows one whole divided into four equal parts. Each part is labeled one-fourth. Two parts are shaded. The rectangle on the bottom shows one whole divided into eight equal parts. Each part is labeled one-eighth. Four parts are shaded. A number line below the rectangles shows tick marks above the number line from zero-fourths to four-fourths and below the number line from zero-eighths to eight-eighths. A blue and purple point appears at tick mark two-fourths, which is the same as four-eighths. !

hints.content: $\purpleD{N}$ is located at the same point on the number line as $\blueD{\dfrac24}$.

The following number line is equivalent to $\dfrac{2}{4}$.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, three unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark at point N, three unlabeled tick marks, and an ending tick mark at 1. !

question.content:
**Which number line shows a number equivalent to $\dfrac{2}{4}$? **

[[☃ radio 2]]

choices.content: ![A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, an unlabeled tick mark, a tick mark at Point L, and an ending tick mark at 1.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6a35a81176b1d5f85bf6900e494fe23942b264ee)

![A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, three unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark at point N, three unlabeled tick marks, and an ending tick mark at 1.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b9f7818a148771f0a88664ac3baa45c0a4fa1d28)
